1. As of March 28, 2015, what proportion of wholesale segment doors were situated in Europe?

\]

instruction: 2. By March 28, 2015, what percentage of wholesale segment doors had been located in Europe?
output:
\[

\]

instruction: 3. On March 28, 2015, what fraction of wholesale segment doors were based in Europe?

\]

instruction: 4. What was the percentage of wholesale segment doors located in Europe as of March 28, 2015?
output:
\[

\]

instruction: 5. As of March 28th, 2015, what percentage of the wholesale segment doors were located within Europe?

\]

1. For the year ending in 2015, what was the percentage difference in the 5-year cumulative total return between Comcast Class A shares and the S&P 500 index?
output:
\[
\text{Difference (\%)} = \left( \frac{P_{\text{Comcast, end}} - P_{\text{Comcast, start}}}{P_{\text{Comcast, start}}} \right) \times 100\% - \left( \frac{P_{\text{S\&P500, end}} - P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}}{P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

instruction: 2. In the year concluded 2015, by what percentage did the 5-year cumulative total return of Comcast Class A stock differ from that of the S&P 500 index?
output:
\[
\text{Difference (\%)} = \left( \frac{P_{\text{Comcast, end}} - P_{\text{Comcast, start}}}{P_{\text{Comcast, start}}} \right) \times 100\% - \left( \frac{P_{\text{S\&P500, end}} - P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}}{P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

instruction: 3. What percentage represented the difference in the 5-year cumulative total returns of Comcast Class A stock versus the S&P 500 index for the year ending 2015?
output:
\[
\text{Difference (\%)} = \left( \frac{P_{\text{Comcast, end}} - P_{\text{Comcast, start}}}{P_{\text{Comcast, start}}} \right) \times 100\% - \left( \frac{P_{\text{S\&P500, end}} - P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}}{P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

instruction: 4. During the year ending in 2015, what was the percentage variation in the 5-year cumulative total return between Comcast Class A shares and the S&P 500 stock index?
output:
\[
\text{Difference (\%)} = \left( \frac{P_{\text{Comcast, end}} - P_{\text{Comcast, start}}}{P_{\text{Comcast, start}}} \right) \times 100\% - \left( \frac{P_{\text{S\&P500, end}} - P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}}{P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

instruction: 5. By what percentage did Comcast Class A stock's 5-year cumulative total return differ from the S&P 500 index for the fiscal year ending 2015?
output:
\[
\text{Difference (\%)} = \left( \frac{P_{\text{Comcast, end}} - P_{\text{Comcast, start}}}{P_{\text{Comcast, start}}} \right) \times 100\% - \left( \frac{P_{\text{S\&P500, end}} - P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}}{P_{\text{S\&P500, start}}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)}{\left( \frac{\text{Net Debt}_{2012}}{\text{Net Capital Excl. Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)} \right) \times 100\%

Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)}{\left( \frac{\text{Net Debt}_{2012}}{\text{Net Capital Excl. Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)} \right) \times 100\%

instruction: 3. Calculate the percentage difference in net debt compared to net capital, excluding securitization bonds, from 2012 to 2013.

Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)}{\left( \frac{\text{Net Debt}_{2012}}{\text{Net Capital Excl. Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)} \right) \times 100\%

instruction: 4. Determine the percent change in the net debt-to-net capital ratio, excluding securitization bonds, between 2012 and 2013.

Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)}{\left( \frac{\text{Net Debt}_{2012}}{\text{Net Capital Excl. Secur. Bonds}_{2012}} \right)} \right) \times 100\%

1. What was the average cash conversion cycle over three years in days?
output:
\[
\text{Average Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)} = \frac{\text{CCC}_{\text{Year 1}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 2}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 3}}}{3}
\]

Where each Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) is calculated as:

\[
\text{CCC} = \text{Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)} + \text{Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)} - \text{Days Payables Outstanding (DPO)}
\]

instruction: 2. Over the three-year period, what was the mean duration of the cash conversion cycle in days?
output:
\[
\text{Average Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)} = \frac{\text{CCC}_{\text{Year 1}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 2}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 3}}}{3}
\]

Where each Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) is calculated as:

\[
\text{CCC} = \text{Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)} + \text{Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)} - \text{Days Payables Outstanding (DPO)}
\]

instruction: 3. How many days constituted the three-year average for the cash conversion cycle?
output:
\[
\text{Average Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)} = \frac{\text{CCC}_{\text{Year 1}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 2}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 3}}}{3}
\]

Where each Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) is calculated as:

\[
\text{CCC} = \text{Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)} + \text{Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)} - \text{Days Payables Outstanding (DPO)}
\]

instruction: 4. What is the day count for the average cash conversion cycle across three years?
output:
\[
\text{Average Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)} = \frac{\text{CCC}_{\text{Year 1}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 2}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 3}}}{3}
\]

Where each Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) is calculated as:

\[
\text{CCC} = \text{Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)} + \text{Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)} - \text{Days Payables Outstanding (DPO)}
\]

instruction: 5. During the three-year span, what was the cash conversion cycle's average length in days?
output:
\[
\text{Average Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC)} = \frac{\text{CCC}_{\text{Year 1}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 2}} + \text{CCC}_{\text{Year 3}}}{3}
\]

Where each Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) is calculated as:

\[
\text{CCC} = \text{Days Inventory Outstanding (DIO)} + \text{Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)} - \text{Days Payables Outstanding (DPO)}
\]

2. Between 2017 and 2018, what was the percentage of the carrying amount of certain mortgage loans HFS as reported on the consolidated balance sheet?<sep >

4. From 2017 to 2018, what percentage of the carrying amounts of particular mortgage loans HFS were reported on the consolidated balance sheet?<sep >
5. What was the percentage of the carrying value of certain mortgage loans HFS reported in the consolidated balance sheet during 2017 to 2018?
output:
\[
\text{Percentage of Carrying Amount} = \left( \frac{\text{Carrying Amount of HFS Mortgage Loans}}{\text{Total Carrying Amount of Mortgage Loans}} \right) \times 100\%
\]

1. What percentage of operating lease payments must be made within a year?

\]
